original_title: Sri Lanka’s mid day shares slip
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid day trade on Wednesday, on profit taking and selling pressures as policy rates have come down, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index was down 0.31 percent or 26.71 points to 8,719.74, while S&P SL20 was down 0.55 percent or 13.56 points to 2,464.80.
“Investors are seeing some selling pressures through built up confidence as policy rates came down,” an analyst said.
